src_text: Lokusha Mayelana Neligciwane Lesifo Se-(COVID-19) Nakakhuluma nesive ngaLesitsatfu, mhla ti-16 Inyoni 2020, Mengameli Cyril Ramaphosa umemetele kungena eSigabeni Sekucaphela sekumiswa kwavelonkhe kwekusebenta kwetintfo kusukela ngeMsombuluko, mhla tinge-21 Inyoni 2020.
trg_text: Update on the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) In his address to the nation on Wednesday, 16 September 2020, President Cyril Ramaphosa announced the move to Alert Level 1 of the national lockdown with effect from Monday, 21 September 2020.

src_text: Lemitsetfomgomo lemisha isuse imitsetfo levimbelako letsite leyacala kusebenta kusukela ngeNdlovulenkhulu 2020 kuvikela kubhebhetseka kwaleligciwan Ifaka ekhatsi, emkhatsini walokunye, linani lelivumelekile lebantfu emihlanganweni yemimango, emicimbini kanye nasemingcwabeni, kanye nekuvulwa kweminyele kute kutsi bantfu bakhone kuhamba khona lapha e-Afrika kanye nekuya ngephandle kulamanye emave, kutawucala kusebenta kusuka mhla lu-01 Imphala 2024.
trg_text: The new regulations eased certain restrictions implemented since March 2020 to prevent the spread of the viru They include, amongst others, the permissible number of people at public gatherings, events and funerals, as well as the opening of borders for travel within Africa and internationally, effective from 1 October 2020.Cabinet has encouraged further engagement with the traditional leadership to address issues related to initiation schools and practices, which are still prohibited during Alert Level 1.

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ikhutsata bonkhe bantfu baseNingizimu Afrika kutsi bachubeke bahloniphe tinchubo tetemphilo te-COVID-19 njengekugcina libanga lekungasondzelani nalomunye umuntfu, kufaka sifonyo nawusemkhatsini webantfu kanye nekugeza njalo tandla ngemanti nangensipho nome ngekusebentisa sibulalimagciwane setandla lesinetjwal Ikhabhinethi iphindza futsi igcugcutela ummango kutsi udawunilode i-app yamakhalekhikhini leCaphelisa nge-COVID ku-Apple App Store nome ku-Google Play Stor Le-app emanethiwekhi abomakhalekhikhini ayente yangakhokhelwa lutfo futsi ungayidawuniloda ngaphandle kwetindleko temadatha
trg_text: More information on the gazetted regulations is accessible on the government website (wwgoza).Cabinet urges all people in South Africa to continue observing the COVID-19 health protocols such as maintaining social distancing, wearing a mask in public and regularly washing hands with soap and water or using an alcohol-based hand sanitiseCabinet also encourages the public to download the COVID Alert mobile app from the Apple App Store or Google Play Stor The app

src_text: itakwenta ncono kulandzelela bantfu labatsintsene ngekutsi icaphelise labayisebentisako nangabe kwentekile batsintsana nalabo labayisebentisako labahlolwe batfolakala bane-COVID-19 etinsukwini le-14 letendlulil Le-App ayigcini nome ngabe nguluphi lwatiso lwakho nome kutfungatsa lowo loyisebentisako kutsi ukuphi nendzawo Budlova Lobucondziswe Kubulili Lobutsite Kanye Nekubulawa Kwalabasikati (i-GBVF) Ikhabhinethi itimisele kulwa nalesishayo se-GBVF ngekucinisa emaklasta etinhlaka tekuvikeleka; luhlakamsebenti lwemtsetfo; kunika kwesekelwa ngekwenhlalo nangekwengcondvo kanye nangetinhlelo tekwesekela khona lapha emimangwen Ngekususela kumininingwane letfolwe kuTemisebenti Yemaphoyisa aseNingizimu Afrika (i-SAPS), hulumende ngalokukhulu kudzabuka sewubone tindzawobucayi te-GBVF letinge-30 kuleliv Ikhabhinethi iyicinisekisile lemimango letsintsekako kutsi kusebentisana nemaphoyisa, tinyatselo tekungenelela titawuciniswa kucinisekisa kuvikeleka kanye nekuphepha kwabomake nebantfwan Ikhabhinethi itemukele futsi yatidvumisa letigidzi letinge-R50 letingumnikelo lonikelwe yi-United Kingdom kusita Sikhwama Semfelandzawonye emitameni yaso yekulwa nemonakalo kutemnotfo lobangwe lubhubhane lwe-COVID-19.
trg_text: Based on data obtained through the South African Police Service (SAPS), government has sadly identified 30 GBVF hotspots around the countr Cabinet has assured the affected communities that working with the police, intervention measures will be strengthened to ensure the protection and safety of women and childreCabinet has welcomed and appreciated the R50-million donation from the United Kingdom which will extend the Solidarity Fund s ongoing efforts to counter the economic devastation caused by the COVID-19 pandemi The funds will focus on projects that support and promote womeCabinet also expressed concern at disturbing reports of human-trafficking incidences involving women and children in the countr Police are following up and investigating all reported cases related to human and drug traffickinCabinet appeals to the public to report these heinous crimes to the police immediately instead of using social media platforms, which makes it difficult for law-enforcement agencies to respond quickly and adequatel The public is again cautioned to refrain from peddling fake news, which may cause unnecessary panic, inflame emotions and incite violence in our societAnyone with information should contact the SAPS on the Crime Stop number 08600 10111 or use the free MySAPS Application, which can be downloaded on any iPhone or smartphone Destruction and theft of public infrastructureCabinet welcomes the recent arrests of suspects in Johannesburg and Cape Town involved in stealing copper cables and train signal cable Police also acted swiftly in arresting people involved in the destruction of the main road in Msinga, KwaZulu-Nata Cabinet commends this breakthrough made by the police on the theft and vandalizing of the rail infrastructure; a serious crime which resulted in some instances in the loss of innocent lives due to train collusion Public infrastructure remains the cornerstone of driving our econom It remains a critical component in our drive to grow the economy and create the much-needed job Cabinet calls on all South Africans to report these criminal activities to the policeSouth African Social Security Agency (SASSA) online serviceCabinet welcomed the launch of the online grant application portal by the SASSA, which enables applications to be lodged on https://servicesassgoz The portal

src_text: Lomhlangano ubutsele ndzawonye Tindvuna teTekuhwebelana temave eminotfo lemcoka, lokufaka ekhatsi iMelika, iShayina, iJapan, iNdiya, iBrazil kanye neJaliman INingizimu Afrika beyimelelwe yiNdvuna yeTekuhwebelana, Tetimboni Netekuchudzelana Ebrahim Pate Kusitatimende sawo, lomhlangano uchaze ngekubaluleka kwekwehlukahlukana kweteminotfo, lokusizatfu sekwesekela kwakha emakhono alelive ekukhicita kulelive emikhakheni lemcoka, lefaka ekhatsi temitsi nekudl Lomhlangano uphindze futsi wesekela tinyatselo tekukhutsata kutfutfukiswa kwabomake kutemnotfo kanye nakumabhizinisi lamancane kakhulu, lamancane, nalasemkhatsini kanye nekubona bungoti bekuhwebelana ngalokungekho emtsetfweni Umhlangano Wemkhandlu Wetindvuna Telubambano Lwetekutseliswa Kwemphahla LwaseNingizimu ye-Afrika (i-SACU) Ikhabhinethi iyemukele imiphumela yeMhlangano weMkhandlu weTindvuna we-SACU lobewubanjwe ngeMsombuluko, mhla tinge-21 Inyoni 2020.
trg_text: The meeting brought together Trade Ministers from key economies, including the United States, China, Japan, India, Brazil and German South Africa was represented by Trade, Industry and Competition Minister Ebrahim PateIn its statement, the meeting outlined the importance of economic diversification, which lays the basis for support to build the country s domestic manufacturing capabilities in critical sectors, including pharmaceuticals and fooThe meeting also supported measures to promote women s economic empowerment and micro, small and medium enterprises and recognised the risks of illicit trade Southern African Customs Union (SACU) Council of Ministers MeetingCabinet welcomed the outcomes of the SACU Council of Ministers Meeting held on Monday, 21 September 2020.

src_text: Tindvuna Tetekuhwebelana neTetimali letivela eNamibia, eBotswana, Eswatini, eLesotho naseNingizimu Afrika tawuhambela lomhlangano, sihlalo wawo bekukadze kuyiNdvuna yeTetimali, Tito Mboweni kantsi leNingizimu Afrika belimelelwe yiNdvuna Pate Lomkhandlu ubuke indzima ledlalwa yi-SACU kundzikimba yeSivumelwane lesisha Sekuhwebelana Ngekukhululeka eVenikati lase-Afrik Wancuma kutsi umsebenti wemkhandlu wesikhatsi lesitako utawugcila ekwakheni kanye nasekutfutfukiseni emave langaphasi kwe-SACU kutsi acine ekwakheni imphahla kanye nemkhakha wemcondvo lomusha longanika imphahla netinsita kulelivekati lonkhan Tincumo Tekhabhinehi1.
trg_text: Finance and Trade Ministers from Namibia, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho and South Africa attended the meeting, which was chaired by Finance Minister Tito Mboweni and South Africa was represented by Minister PateThe council considered the role of SACU in the context of the new African Continental Free Trade Agreemen It resolved that the future work of the council will focus on building and developing SACU countries into a stronger manufacturing and innovation hub that can provide goods and services across the continen CABINET DECISIONS1.

trg_text: Correctional Services Amendment Bill of 2020Cabinet approved the submission of the Correctional Services Amendment Bill of 2020 to Parliamen The amendments are primarily in response to the Constitutional Court judgement handed down in the Phaahla Judgement on 3 May 2019.The amendments entrench the right to a fair trial as contemplated in Section 35(3)(n) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 in the application of the Section 136 (1) of the Correctional Services Act, 1998 (Act 111 of 1998) SAPS Amendment Bill of 2020Cabinet approved publication of the Bill in the Government Gazette for public comment The Bill amends the SAPS Act, 1995 (Act 68 of 1995), to bring it in line with the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 and to ensure optimal policin

src_text: Mengameli Ramaphosa utakwetfula inkhulumo yakhe esiveni kumabonakudz Bantfu baseNingizimu Afrika bayagcugcutelwa kutsi basebentise Inyanga Yemagugu Nemasiko kutsi bagubhe emasiko etfu lanotsile nemagugu, futsi batimbandzakanye ekwakheni sive kanye nasemisebentini lesihlanganisako ngekwenhlal Mengameli Ramaphosa ugcugcutele bantfu baseNingizimu Afrika kutsi bajoyine senteko semhlaba wonkhe bangenele incabhayi yemdanso wengoma iJerusalema ngeLusuku Lwemagugu Nemasik Ikhabhinethi ibudvumisile buciko baMaster KG (lotelwe atiwa ngelaKgaogelo Moagi) ngekukhipha iJerusalema, ingoma ledvumile lefaka ekhatsi umculi nembhali wetingoma Nomcebo Zikod Ikhabhinethi iyababonga ngekuphakamisa emakhono ebuciko bemculo alelive, kulengoma lenyakatise umhlaba wonkh SebangeMancusa etfu ngekwemtsetfo eTemasiko Nebuciko eMhlaben IMILAYETO1.
trg_text: for producing Jerusalema, the popular song featuring vocalist and songwriter Nomcebo Zikod Cabinet thanks them for bringing to the fore the country s artistic musical skills and capability, on this song that has taken the world by stor They are our official Arts and Culture Ambassadors to the Worl MESSAGES1.

src_text: KudvudvutaIkhabhinethi ivakalisa emavi ekudvudvuta kumndeni nakubangani: bemphenyi longumnkantjubovu, Kholoneli longuLifutheneni Charl Kinnear, lowabulawelwa ngephandle kwelikhaya lakhe eBishop Lavis eKap Unikele emashumi lamatsatfu emphilo yakhe kuLuphiko lweMaphoyisa aseNingizimu Afrika futsi bekaphenya bugebengu lobuhleliwe kuleliv Sayitjeni Thabile Mapoma, lowabulawa ngesihluku eKhayelitsha eNshonalanga Kap Lilunga leMkhandlu weSigungu seLibhola Lembhoco laseNingizimu Afrika, Mn Monde Tabata, lobekaneminyaka lenge-60.
